snippet: The latest budget impasse ushered in a new round of austerity, with the nation facing reduced federal services, canceled contracts and layoffs from cuts that reduce projected deficits but could hamper the economy.
abstract: Latest budget impasse ushers in a new round of austerity, with the nation facing reduced federal services, canceled contracts, job furloughs and layoffs;  lost in the dysfunction is this fact: on paper, Pres Obama and Congress have reduced projected deficits by nearly $4 trillion over a decade, the widely embraced goal for stabilizing the national debt; if the latest cuts stick, the two parties will have achieved nearly the full amount of deficit reduction over the next decade that economists and market analysts have promoted.
lead_paragraph: The latest budget impasse ushered in a new round of austerity, with the nation facing reduced federal services, canceled contracts and layoffs from cuts that reduce projected deficits but could hamper the economy.

headline.main: Cuts to Achieve Goal for Deficit, but Toll Is High
headline.print_headline: Cuts to Achieve Goal for Deficit, But Toll Is High
